New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became only the fourth team in NBA history to win 15 straight games to begin a season.
Coach Kenny Atkinson's 15 wins to start a career with a new team is a league record.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland led the Cavs with 25 points, 12 assists, and five rebounds.
Ty Jerome added 24 points and Evan Mobley put up 23 points with 11 assists.
Evan Mobley blocked Hornets forward Brandon Miller’s dunk attempt with two minutes remaining.
The Cavaliers scored 72 points in the first half and led the entire game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers are proving night after night this start isn’t a fluke. They are a rising power in the NBA.
Coach Kenny Atkinson has overhauled an offense that played slow last year and relied too heavily on stale pick and rolls.
Atkinson keeps cautioning that they’re shooting above their heads and eventually the numbers will stabilize, but it hasn’t happened yet.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers notched their 14th consecutive win Friday night against the Chicago Bulls for a franchise record.
Cleveland leads the league in 3-point shooting percentage and entered Sunday shooting 50 percent on wide-open 3s.
